title: Kate Hudson Finds Her Voice: How the ‘Song Sung Blue’ Star Landed Her Greatest Role Since Penny Lane and Why Oscar Buzz Doesn’t ‘Define My Value’
summary: Kate Hudson doesn’t often cry when she screens her own movies — she’s too busy critiquing her work — but watching her latest film, “Song Sung Blue,” was an exception. She was sitting in a darkened room with her mom, Goldie Hawn, and her “pa,” Kurt Russell, Hawn’s longtime partner. Instead of nitpic…
